page.title: 09HOME LIFE:WILBERLEE/HILLTOP.
page.content: The 1981 Census tells us that in the Slaithwaite/Marsden area, the level of social wellbeing is 'below average'. Less than 4% of the households have six or more people in them and rhe average person per room ratio is below 0.60.Below 0.5% of the population are of West Indian or Asian origin. Our own survey showed that most people in each household belong to the same nuclear family with few in-laws or dependents living in.An estimated 25% of the population of the block are pensioners and most like to lead an independent life.They own or rent some 40% of the Victorian and Edwardian terraced properties in HillTop.Others live in the bungalows in Olney Street and Mona Street designed by Kirklees Council for pensioners.Many were born here and used to work locally.They have no intention of moving away.
